quote: Character is power; it makes friends, draws patronage and support and opens the way to wealth, honor and happiness.
Ability is a poor man's wealth.
All riches have their origin in mind. Wealth is in ideas - not money.
All wealth is the product of labor.
An unhurried sense of time is in itself a form of wealth.
Character is power; it makes friends, draws patronage and support and opens the way to wealth, honor and happiness.
Ability is a poor man's wealth.
All riches have their origin in mind. Wealth is in ideas - not money.
All wealth is the product of labor.
An unhurried sense of time is in itself a form of wealth.
Be charitable before wealth makes thee covetous.
Be charitable before wealth makes you covetous.
Capital is that part of wealth which is devoted to obtaining further wealth.
Contentment is natural wealth, luxury is artificial poverty.
Controlled time is our true wealth.
Don't judge men's wealth or godliness by their Sunday appearance.
Economy is based on the principle that all wealth has its limits.
Eulogy. Praise of a person who has either the advantages of wealth and power, or the consideration to be dead.
Excellence encourages one about life generally; it shows the spiritual wealth of the world.
For there is no defense for a man who, in the excess of his wealth, has kicked the great altar of Justice out of sight.
Give me the poverty that enjoys true wealth.
God shows his contempt for wealth by the kind of person he selects to receive it.
Great eagerness in the pursuit of wealth, pleasure, or honor, cannot exist without sin.
He does not posses wealth that allows it to possess him.
He is rich who is content with the least; for contentment is the wealth of nature.
He that fails in his endeavors after wealth or power will not long retain either honesty or courage.
He who loses wealth loses much; he who loses a friend loses more; but he that loses his courage loses all.
Health is the greatest gift, contentment the greatest wealth, faithfulness the best relationship.
I have no riches but my thoughts. Yet these are wealth enough for me.
I think when you spread the wealth around, it's good for everybody
I would give all the wealth of the world, and all the deeds of all the heroes, for one true vision.
If a man is proud of his wealth, he should not be praised until it is known how he employs it.
If we command our wealth, we shall be rich and free. If our wealth commands us, we are poor indeed.
Ill fares the land, to hastening ills a prey, where wealth accumulates, and men decay.
It is great wealth to a soul to live frugally with a contented mind.
It is neither wealth nor splendor; but tranquillity and occupation which give happiness.
It is only when the rich are sick that they fully feel the impotence of wealth.
It is pretty hard to tell what does bring happiness; poverty and wealth have both failed.
It is the interest of the commercial world that wealth should be found everywhere.
It is well to be up before daybreak, for such habits contribute to health, wealth, and wisdom.
It is wrong to assume that men of immense wealth are always happy.
It is wrong to assume that men of immense wealth are always happy.
Money is good, love is wealth.
Much learning shows how little mortals know; much wealth, how little wordings enjoy.
Neither wealth or greatness render us happy.
No one is so miserable as the poor person who maintains the appearance of wealth.
Nothing is rich but the inexhaustible wealth of nature. She shows us only surfaces, but she is a million fathoms deep.
Of great wealth there is no real use, except in its distribution, the rest is just conceit.
Oil wealth has been a curse on us, made us weak and docile.
People of Wealth and the so called upper class suffer the most from boredom.
So many people spend their health gaining wealth, and then have to spend their wealth to regain their health.
Superfluous wealth can buy superfluities only. Money is not required to buy one necessary of the soul.
Teach us that wealth is not elegance, that profusion is not magnificence, that splendor is not beauty.
The first wealth is health.
The first wealth is health.
The glory that goes with wealth and beauty is fleeting and fragile; virtue is a possession glorious and eternal.
The gratification of wealth is not found in mere possession or in lavish expenditure, but in its wise application.
The greatest wealth is to live content with little, for there is never want where the mind is satisfied.
The higher goal of spiritual living is not to amass a wealth of information, but to face sacred moments
The loss of wealth is loss of dirt, as sages in all times assert; The happy man's without a shirt.
The only question with wealth is, what do you do with it?
The only question with wealth is, what do you do with it?
The only thing wealth does for some people is to make them worry about losing it.
The only wealth is life.
The way to wealth depends on just two words, industry and frugality.
The wealth of a soul is measured by how much it can feel; its poverty by how little.
The wealth that cannot be administered is a burden.
There is a time when a man distinguishes the idea of felicity from the idea of wealth; it is the beginning of wisdom.
There is no real wealth but the labor of man.
We have entered the cell, the Mansion of our birth, and started the inventory of our acquired wealth.
We have no more right to consume happiness without producing it than to consume wealth without producing it.
Wealth - Any income that is at least $100 more a year than the income of one's wife's sister's husband.
Wealth and want equally harden the human heart, like frost and fire both are alien to human flesh.
Wealth is conspicuous, but poverty hides.
Wealth is like sea-water; the more we drink, the thirstier we become; and the same is true of fame.
Wealth is not a matter of intelligence it's a matter of inspiration.
Wealth is not his that has it, but his that enjoys it.
Wealth is not in making money, but in making the man while he is making money.
Wealth is the ability to fully experience life.
Wealth is the product of man's capacity to think.
Wealth is well known to be a great comforter.
Wealth lost is something lost, honor lost is something lost: Courage lost all is lost.
Wealth stays with us a little moment if at all: only our characters are steadfast, not our gold.
Wealth unused might as well not exist.
Wealth, in even the most improbable cases, manages to convey the aspect of intelligence.
Wealth, religion, military victory have more rhetorical than efficacious worth.
When you play it too safe, you're taking the biggest risk of your life. Time is the only wealth we're given.
Where people are really attached, poverty itself is wealth.
Where there are friends there is wealth.
Whoever does not regard what he has as most ample wealth, is unhappy, though he be master of the world.
Without a rich heart, wealth is an ugly beggar.
There is no wealth but life.
